title: const_generics with a macro causes rustc to panic.

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body: I tried this code: https://github.com/comath/ruiso/tree/error Run `cargo run --example expanded_struct_bad` to reproduce Run `cargo run --example expanded_struct`, `rustup example/expanded_struct.rs`, or `cargo build` to have a passing example. This should be what the bad code with the macro expands to. I expected to see this happen: Compiled, with a passed test (pulled this out of a test to an example to see the expanded code) Instead, this happened: unhappy compiler ## Meta Backtrace: ``` sven@sven-mbp:~/code/rust_tutorial/ruiso (master*+%) % cargo run --example expanded_struct_bad Compiling ruiso v0.1.0 (/Users/sven/code/rust_tutorial/ruiso) warning: the feature `const_generics` is incomplete and may cause the compiler to crash --> examples/expanded_struct_bad.rs:1:12 | 1 | #![feature(const_generics)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_metadata/decoder.rs:474: entry: id not found: DefIndex(39) in crate ruiso with number 15 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:812:9 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: std::io::Write::write_fmt 3: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 4: std::panicking::default_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: std::panicking::begin_panic 8: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::bug 9: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 10: rustc::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 11: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 12: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_context_opt 13: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt 14: rustc::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 15: rustc::util::bug::bug_fmt unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.39.0-nightly (6ef275e6c 2019-09-24) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic:
